intro: Arabis pieninica, commonly known as the Pienin Arabis, is a flowering plant native to the Pieniny Mountains in Poland. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. Arabis pieninica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in local biodiversity.
